personal_info.name: Ayaz Al Abrar
personal_info.headline: Mechanical Design Engineer | CSWP | Walton | Lift

about:
Looking forward to adding the vibrant colors of positive energy into the canvas of my life, creating a masterpiece of joy and fulfillment.
I am a Mechanical Engineering graduate from KUET. I worked as CEO at CADers, a club that works with Computer Aided Designing. I also worked as Designer and Mechanical Control Expert(Braking) at Team Kiloflight, a formula student team of KUET.
Engineering designing excites me and I am very interested in learning different software about this. I am a certified SolidWorks professional and associate. Besides SolidWorks, I am familiar with AutoCAD, Blender, Fusion 360 and rendering software like Keyshot. I have worked with ANSYS(Structural Simulation) during my Team Kiloflight period. I completed my thesis which was based on ANSYS Fluent, another simulation software. I compensate for any skill deficiencies with my unwavering commitment to acquiring knowledge and improving.
Besides these, I love sports, both Cricket and Football. I also love doing amateur photography and videography.

education.school: Khulna University of Engineering and Technology
education.degree: Bachelor of Science - BS, Mechanical Engineering

interests.name: Khulna University of Engineering and Technology

Alhamdulillah
Thrilled to announce the successful defense of my undergraduate thesis titled "Investigation on the Effect of Front Wall Geometry and Orifice Shape of Oscillating Water Column Device: Numerical Approach." Dive deep into the dynamics of renewable energy as I explore the influence of design elements on wave energy conversion. Grateful for the guidance of mentors and the support of peers. Excited for the next chapter in advancing sustainable solutions!

11 march, 2024

A year ago, I completed my industrial attachment at Orion Power Rupsha Ltd., a high-capacity diesel engine HFO-based power plant producing 105 MW. Reflecting on the valuable experiences and skills gained during this significant chapter in my engineering journey.
